Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Here are our final actual costs for this year.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm... okay.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: As you can see, we did pretty well, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Yes, I can see... that we did indeed. Why don't you explain this to me like I am an eight-year old.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Alright, well this is the overall budget for this fiscal year along the x-axis...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Right there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's the x-ax...icks.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You can see clearly on this page that we have a surplus of $4300.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmhmm, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: But we have to spend that by the end of the day or it will be deducted from next year's budget.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't you explain this to me like I'm five.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Your mommy and daddy give you ten dollars to open up a lemonade stand. So you go out and you buy cups and you buy lemons and you buy sugar. And now you find out that it only costs you nine dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ho-oh!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: So you have an extra dollar.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: So you can give that dollar back to mommy and daddy, but guess what? Next summer...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll be six.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: And you ask them for money, they're gonna give you nine dollars. 'Cause that's what they think it costs to run the stand. So what you want to do is spend that dollar on something now, so that your parents think it costs ten dollars to run the lemonade stand.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So the dollar's a surplus. This is a surplus.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We have to spend that $4300 by the end of the day or it'll be deducted from next year's budget.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whistles poorly] Whoo.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We should spend this money on a new copier, which we desperately need.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, break it down in terms of, um... okay, I-I think I'm getting you...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guess what, everybody? Christmas has come early this year. Oscar, very smartly, has discovered an extra $4300 in the budget. Thank you, Oscar. And I have decided with that money I am going to buy a new, drum roll please... [imitates drum roll] Can anybody guess?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: New chairs?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, a new copier! [only Oscar applauds] Unless everybody can agree on something better?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, no, please. Please do not do this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, Michael, new chairs. These chairs are terrible. We were supposed to get new ones last year.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So... we all agree to get new chairs then. Good?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [over indistinct conversation] Good? Yeah, he said good, I'm good...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Now listen, we are a paper company. How can we take pride in our jobs if we have to put our fine paper in this wretched machine?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oscar, no. This is not the time for one of your principled stands.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Pam, you make more copies than anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Exactly. That should tell you how terrible the chairs are.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay, good suggestions. All good suggestions. Uh, let's just decide and agree upon one.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm with Pam. Chairs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, so, teams forming.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: We should really have the office's air quality tested. We have radon coming from below, we have asbestos in the ceilings. These are silent killers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are the silent killer. Go back to the annex.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You'll see.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I've talked to Meredith, Stanley and Jim about the chairs. I know they're with me on this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, actually, I'm gonna go with copier.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What? Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ever since Pam and I started dating, I just feel weird asking her to make copies for me. So, I make my own copies. And that copier sucks. Let me tell you, I-But you know what? Pam and I don't have to agree on everything.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Jim, good for you, standing up to Pam like that.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: The balls on you, man.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: So Michael, what do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You have to make the decision.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, okay. Well... I swallowed all your ideas, I'm going to digest them and see what comes out the other end.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight, I'm a little concerned about some of these directions to Schrute Farms...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, do tell.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I mean, like, "156 paces from the light red mailbox, make a left."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: "Walk until you hear the beehive."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How could it be more clear?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I think Andy makes an excellent point.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: But my biggest concern is that there's only one bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We'll dig a trench. As long as it's downhill from the well, we should be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Nana Mimi cannot squat over some trench.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well we're not gonna put out stumps, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let's three-way this little issue, and come to a solution by the time we get to Schrute Farms, how's that for a plan?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We're getting married at Schrute Farms, no matter what. I have looked at twelve venues, I have lost eight deposits, and I have seen Angela naked zero times. I am not losing another deposit.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So um, I've been thinking about this whole chair/copier thing...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I really think you should reconsider.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, Pam, I really... hate that copier.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But I really think you should reconsider.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Beesly, are you threatening me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim. Jim, Jim, Jim. I'm not threatening you. I love you. [whispers] But you should know, you're on very dangerous ground [kisses Jim]. [at normal volume] All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [shudders] Whew.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is where you'll have your receiving line. Of course we'll clear out all the livestock and hay and such.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hmm... mm, what's that smell?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're gonna need to be more specific.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Manure. Get rid of it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Manure covers up the small of the slaughterhouse.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Do you have to slaughter on our wedding day?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You wanna eat, don't you?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Honey, say something!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, Dwight, if we pay extra, could you slaughter the entrees the day before?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...I'll consider it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: See? That's how you do it! Makin' progress here. [steps in manure, trying to laugh it off] ...Darn! Heh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's a hose out back.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Remember, you were gonna get a new chair, and you were gonna give your old chair to me. Remember that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well that never happened.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know. I haven't decided yet.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm just gonna grab some lunch. You wanna come with?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? Absolutely! Yeah, that would be amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Woah, you guys going to lunch?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mind if I join?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohh, God!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Best lunch ever! Woo-hoo-hoo-hoo!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right! Cool!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where we going?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, I guess that's how they're gonna play this. It is on. [very serious] It is so on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Look, I really need this new chair. I mean, seriously, how is it possible that in five years I've had two engagement rings, and only one chair?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [laughing uproariously with Michael and Jim] Stop it! Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, that is hilarious.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [through the laughter] Oh, is somebody making fun of me?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The best. Great friends. Thank you, Michael. [all three are still laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ahh... I got you some tiramisu. No hard feelings.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Aww.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's cool. [opens the container and smells the tiramisu] Mm, good stuff. [throws it in the garbage]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You look really pretty.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you. [goes to Michael's office and knocks on the door]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You got a second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, that must've been so fun.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: it was fun. We had a good time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, have I told you you look really nice today?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, is that a new tie?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, no, not... no. No, I got it at TJ Maxx, four dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That is amazing!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You think that's good? Check out these pants. Nine dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nine dollars. The boys' department.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at the ass. Check out the ass.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [applauding] No way!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at that. [begins dancing] Unh. Unh-unh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah! Oh, so I guess Oscar and Jim were talking your ear off about the new copier.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes they were.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They were.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here's what I was thinking:

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Have you made a decision on the butter sculpture?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. I haven't thought of it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Cow, goat or sheep. It's not that hard.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I would like cat.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cats don't make butter.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I would like cow butter sculpture of a cat.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It doesn't make any sense.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes it does!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, guys!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I want a butter sculpture of a cat!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cow, goat or sheep.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What is this? All right, we're all on the same team. Is it- [steps in manure] Damn! Why is that in the kitchen?!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Pam is making copies and is struggling with the machine] You might want to consider changing teams, because we would-we would love to have you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, copier's great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. I have my copies. [holds up messed up copies]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There they are.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And I have my original. [holds up original paper, ripped in half]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You got it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So suck it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, I got you a hot chocolate. I hope that's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you my dear.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Wait, Michael! Let me open the door for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, well, chivalry is not dead after all. Okay...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: There he is!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There he is! Hello, hello!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello! Good to see you! Good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm! [gives Jim a high five] Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's that ass!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey hey! Yeah! Unh!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Woo! Yeah. Aw, don't take it away!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... ah, I almost choked.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here's another place.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey-o!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So... why don't we try this out, we'll see what would happen. Give it a little test drive, what do you say? You pretend to be Angela's father, you will play Angela, and uh, I will pretend to be you. That way you can see what it looks like when you're up here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [whistling Pachelbel's "Canon in D;" switches to singing then back to whistling]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [to minister] Hello, I'm Angela Martin, and-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I work with Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He doesn't understand a word you're saying.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Although born just minutes from here, he speaks only German. Closed society. So, now, after the readings by all of your sisters, we will arrive at the vows. So, Konrad... [speaks German to minister; minister begins speaking in German] And away we go. This is a little taste of the ceremony, if you will. He's explaining why we're here, what we're doing here, making introductions, blah blah blah... Then he's gonna have Andy repeat a bunch of stuff. He's gonna ask Andy to produce a ring. I have uh, now just uh... just some twine for our purposes, and you will put the ring on her finger. Yadda yadda, then he's going to ask Andy, uh, if he would like to marry Angela. And you will reply, "I do." [Andy mouths, "I do" silently] And then he's going to ask Angela if she would like to marry Andy, to which you will reply...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And there we go. Okay, and that's just about it. Man and wife.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Got a call about a problem up here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did somebody call Hank?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hank, thank God you're here. The office is at a crossroads.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: So, there's no security problem? You know, I hustled up the stairs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. I need your sage advice. And everyone, whatever Hank decides, that is the decision. That will resolve this issue. [Hank takes some jellybeans from Pam's jar] Yeah, take as many as you want.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Thank you. Thank you. You know, it's nice and warm up here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: So what are we talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Well, we have a surplus. Imagine that your parents give you money for a lemonade stand-

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: I know what a surplus is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. Good. Good. Well, here's the thing. Some people want to use the surplus to buy a new copier. Other people are complaining about the chairs.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Is that the copier?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: [inspects the copier] Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: I was just thinking. Let me see a chair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You can try mine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, there we go.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Hmm, not much lumbar support.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now everyone, bear in mind once again that whatever Hank says goes. He is an impartial third party.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: On the one hand, this copier is very old. You should see some of the new copiers they have. You would not believe what they do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, the copier.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Well, let me finish.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Now the chairs. The chairs are very weak. Very weak chairs. I could not sit all day in this chair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, what should I do?

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: ...Let me see the copier again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, get out. Get out.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight, I thought I knew what I wanted. And then, being here with you and the German Mennonite minister... it just all felt right. I made a mistake picking Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know you did. And that's why I have taken care of everything.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well Monkey, he's a real minister. And you said, "I do." And I said, "I do." And Andy wasn't signing a receipt; he was signing our marriage certificate as a witness.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight! That doesn't count!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, of course it does.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, it doesn't!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It does in the state of Pennsylvania.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I didn't-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Haha, Mrs. Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We are not married.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wha...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Take this thing. [takes off twine ring]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My... It's not my fault you don't understand German; I've been telling you to take it for years!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are we, uh... are we leaving or what? [Mose hits Andy in the head with a deflated ball] Ow!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone] Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey David- [begins coughing violently] I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'm eating tiramisu. Some of the chocolate powder just went down my throat. I'm stopping now.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Is this why you're calling me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no. No. I'm calling- [coughs again] I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm. I'm calling because, um, we have a stupid budget surplus, and people-everybody wants something different.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You want me to weigh in on a minor budget issue?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. I want you to make the decision so I'm not the bad guy.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Well if I were you, I would just return the surplus and take the bonus.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The what now?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Branch managers who come in under budget get 15% of the savings.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...Like a tip? [calculates amount] $645?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I hate disappointing just one person. And I really hate disappointing everyone. But I love Burlington Coat Factory. You go in there with $645, you are literally a king.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on the phone] We have that going out Tuesday... Okay? Sure, no, I can... I'll double-check that for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, attention everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let me call you right back. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have made my decision. We do not need a new copier. We do not need new chairs. This copier... is... [puts paper on glass and makes a copy, then takes paper from glass] working perfectly.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's the original.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, would you stand up for a sec? [sits in Pam's chair] Hmm. See how relaxed I am? I like this chair. [slowly sinking into the chair] Offers good support, it is urkelnomically correct... it's a good chair. I think we're spoiled because we don't appreciate the things that we have. You think kids in Africa have chairs? No. They sit in big piles of garbage. You think they have copiers? [the chair has slowly lowered itself almost to where Michael is not visible over the desk] They don't have copiers. They don't even- [struggles to get up from Pam's chair] Gah! They don't even have paper. And we are spoiled because we throw out perfectly good tiramisu because it has a little tiny hair on it. My point I this: I have seen the light in terms of what we need, and it is nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Do you know?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do I know what?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I think you know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm, no...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Know what?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, know what?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Does anyone happen to know what 15% of 4300 is?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael's a genius.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why'd you say dollars?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because that is how my mind works.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What's 15% of 200? [Michael doesn't answer] Thank you. Everyone, Michael is returning the surplus so he can keep 15% as a bonus.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, what?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You can do that?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey Michael, what's 394 times 5,912?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's see...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're gonna give yourself a bonus of $645 instead of getting the entire office something it really needs?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't need $645; I already have $645, more or less.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're gonna get us a copier then?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is so stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Or chairs?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is so, so stupid. And, God... [looks at his watch] that's my phone.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I didn't hear a phone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: To be continued!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I don't-this doesn't change anything. I have a very important decision to make. We need a new copier. We need new chairs. And I need to figure out a way to keep this money without having everybody hate me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey Tuna, check it out. Tuna sandwich. Just like you. [Angela walks over to Andy] What-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [kisses Andy passionately in his chair] Now, I have to take care of a legal issue.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Was that hot or what?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So what's it gonna be?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, you have to make a decision. The day is almost done.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Let me just say, you've been promising me this chair since the day you hired me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You are a smart guy. I know you'll do the right thing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [groans in frustration] You think it's easy?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's your job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what? Why don't you guys deal with it? I am going to get up, and I am going to be out in the common area. But you need to decide; otherwise I'm taking the bonus. All right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is a classic management tactic. You have two sides, a deadline, you know that neither of them are gonna concede. What you do is you put 'em in a room, and you just- [Pam and Oscar come to the door of kitchen] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, we're going with the chairs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I just figured I'd rather have new chairs than nothing at all.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good work. I'm proud of you. [Pam and Oscar leave] Mother-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [wearing a fur coat] What did we learn this week? Well, one, thanks to me, my team is much, much faster at coming to decisions than I thought they would be. Number two, never buy a fur coat with a credit card until you absolutely have the money to pay for it. And three, [camera zooms out to see fake blood is splattered on the fur coat] you should know that some people think it's cool to throw buckets of fake blood on you as you are walking out of Burlington Coat Factory.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Truce?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I guess, since I won.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, you did win. You did win. Anyway, I'm going to need three copies of each of these, stapled and collated. [begins to walk away, then turns back] Totally kidding. [leans in, whispers] I'm gonna need four. [kisses Pam]
